intro: Eschscholzia elegans, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open areas and thrives in well-drained soil. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Eschscholzia elegans is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
